intro: Laserpitium triquetrum, commonly known as the three-angled hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are deeply lobed and have a distinctive three-angled appearance, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Laserpitium triquetrum is often found in meadows and is a common sight in the wildflower habitats of its native range.
